alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 12:27PM PDT until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington...Idaho... Methow River near Pateros affecting Okanogan County. St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Major flooding is forecast. Minor flooding is forecast for the St. Joe near St. Maries and near Pateros on the Methow River. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 19.7 feet, Water begins to impact State Route 21 near Little Goosemus Road at mile post 185. At 20.8 feet, Water covers part of Highway 21 near the intersection with Little Goosmus Creek Road between mile post 185 and 189. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 19.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM PDT Saturday was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.0 feet tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.9 feet on 06/01/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Kettle River Ferry above Curlew 18.5 19.6 Sat 11 am PD 20.9 20.6 20.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Sunday morning at 600 AM PDT.
